intro: Columnea dictyophylla, commonly known as the net-leaf columnea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. Its leaves are usually ovate to lanceolate, with a distinctive net-like venation pattern. Columnea dictyophylla thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil for optimal growth.
